Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Aldrich M
Reviews.Content: This NH Hotel Alcala was just what we where looking for. It is well situated, next to the Retiro Park, with a Bus and Metro nearby and in a safe residential area. A good value for your money as far as we are concerned. Reception staff was attentive and readily provided us with an available room before check-in time suggesting a quiet inner one so we could rest. It was clean, comfortable and indeed quiet. We were well advised a did not regret what they recommended when specifying a particular interest. An enjoyable stay that we plan to repeat again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location !”
Reviews.Author: hager_benmahmoud
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit small. The location is excellent and makes it all worth while!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice looking, with a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WillyM
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located a walk away from Plaza Mayor and Gran via street. It is very nice, rooms are well maintained, clean and very comfort beds. Breakfast is rich (for the price paid for the room), tasty and fresh. Coffee is one of the best offered on hotels i was in Spain. for me it was a surprise. On strange thing is the you have free wifi in the lobby, but on the room it cost almost 11 Euros a day, the could improve by giving free wifi in rooms, that would have given my 5th star to the rating. People are very nice and keen to help. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Too Basic, Worth the Low Price I Paid”
Reviews.Author: stp0707
Reviews.Content: This was a decent, clean hotel, but that was about it. The room was incredibly basic with only one pillow per bed (the tube kind), no coffee maker and no artwork. I got a rate through my company of about 45 Euros a night, and I would not have paid more. The Calle de Alcala is boring with very few restaurants or shops of interest and is too far from Chueca to be comfortably walkable. The staff were accommodating but officious. I stayed here one night and would not have stayed any longer, although I would stay here again if I needed to overnight in Madrid. Another option to consider is the NH Sanvy, which is in a brighter neighborhood and slightly closer to Chueca. It also has a Pans and Company downstairs and is close to a small grocer, so there are more options for food there if you are traveling by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “May be it was NY but staff disinterested”
Reviews.Author: Marshmellow66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over New Year. Hotel clean, comfortable, room/bathroom perfect in size and well stocked. Location perfect: in a good neighbourhood just outside old Madrid centre, 10 min walk to Puerto del Sole, lots of goods restaurants near and felt very safe even late at night. Retiro Park and Prado very close. Had breakfast in hotel just one morning, bit on the expensive side but very good bar across road for all you need. The one downside was the reception staff: we asked for assistence in booking a show, they just looked the box office No. up on Internet and told us to get on with it ourselves. Same with taxis, oh just go outside into the road an eventually one will pass by. Extremely disinterested in helping and lacking in real smiles! It wasn't as if they were overworked or anything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Retiro park near”
Reviews.Author: Madridplaces
Reviews.Content: Normal room, confortable bed, clean, silent floor. Friendly staff. The only problem: poor breakfast, in my opinion eggs and bacon is crucial for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Torcuatense
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Xmas. The hotel, apparently has been renovated not long ago. Therefore the rooms are quite comfortable, modern, with a clean bathroom. Service is good, by people ready to assist on anything we needed. For those wanting to visit Madrid for the first time, this is a great deal. Location (above all) is very convenient, close to Metro (only 35 mins metro from the Airport), next to Parque del Retiro, in a very nice area of Madrid. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: leemad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a street away from the Retiro park, in a pleasant area and a 15-20 minute walk from the centre. It's also well located in terms of the underground and bus routes and about a ten minute walk away from the airport shuttle bus stop on Calle O'Donnell - although it's also easy to get to the airport on the Metro. The building is not as impressive as other NH hotels, but the room was lovely, clean and extremely quiet. However, the staff weren't overly friendly and when we checked out we almost ended up paying for someone else's breakfasts as they'd been giving our room number. On another occasion, we had to wait for twenty minutes just to have someone take our order in the café. But overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel located in a good area.”
Reviews.Author: dubmar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there 2 months because I was working in Madrid and this was my second stay there. The hotel is very well located on Alcàla street, and is 2 minutes walk from Retiro park, which is a great place to visit and to relax. There are plenty of restaurants and cafeterias near the hotel. It is also easy to go to the main touristic attractions. If you like to walk, you can get to the 'Gran Via' or 'puerta del sol' within 20-25 minutes, but you can also take the Metro station, which is within 5 minute walking distance and get to the most popular attractions. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The room are a little bit small, but very clean and comfortable. The hotel also have an underground parking but it is very small. The breakfast buffet is very good and healthy, although a little bit on the expensive side...Overall, I find this hotel of a very good quality for the price and highly recommend it for both business people and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend!”
Reviews.Author: Elena1206_11
Reviews.Content: 1) Good rooms: cosy, clean. nice bathroom 2) Good district: close to Retiro park (5 min walk; should be visited), metro station Principe de Vergara (5 min walk) - is easy to get to Plaza del Sol (the same line), to Gran Via etc., close to Goya st. and Serrano - good places for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 nights: Very Satisfied. Nice room; nice view, very clean”
Reviews.Author: WDG123123
Reviews.Content: Our stay was May 14th-16th, 2011. My wife and I were a surprised by the negative reviews, Our room #303 was on the front of the hotel. II had a nice view; it was large, quiet, and very clean. Perhaps, it had been recently refurbished. The bed, the room, and the bathroom were all large and immaculate. The staff was helpful and answered in English any questions that we had. They provided us with a map of the city, directions to the Metro and nearby cafes/restaurants [of which there are many]. The location as great; small grocery across the street. Two metro lines within easy walking distance, and Retiro park just a couple of blocks away. When we asked at the front desk for them to call us a taxi to the airport they called for one and said it would be there in five minutes. Several taxi's stopped out front before ours. When the concierge came and told us ours was there the driver spoke fluent English. The luck of the draw? .. or perhaps they had called an individual who they knew spoke English. Anyhow, he was there in the five minutes that they had indicated. Cost to the Airport including bags, etc was 30 euros and some change. We will definitely stay at the NH Alcala again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: PandC60
Reviews.Content: In view of previous comments, we arrived with some concern. Turned out to be be totally unfounded and we had a very good four night stay.Very clean everywhereand most staff were very helpful, given we speak no Spanish.Our room was classed as "Superior" and had a very large bed, almost seven feet wide, a sitting area and a large en suite. All had been refurbished very recently to a high standard. On the negative side there was no natural light as the window, which was frosted glass, opened onto an inner courtyard. We did not eat breakfast there, there are endless cafes nearby, but did eat in the bar one evening. The choice was very limited, more like sandwiches or pizza with one or two larger dishes. The food was not great and overpriced and given the number of restaurants, eating out is a better option.No noise for us perhaps because we were not looking onto the road. Location is great, near Retiro park and near the Metro station. Previously stayed in Gran Via and that was much noisier. Metros are cheap, very regular and safe even late at night. Overall a good place to stay if you want a "City centre" style hotel with few other amenities

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY OLD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MexicoNora
Reviews.Content: NOT AT ALL A 4 STAR HOTEL, NOT EVEN 3 Rooms with holes in the sheets, the bathroom smelled like sewer, dirty armchairs. Lobby dirty, entrance to the building full of cigarettes stubs on the floor, smelling and dirty. The WIFI offered didn´t work. The only positive aspect was that the personnel was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “NH usual fare”
Reviews.Author: Achille C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a typical NH facility of a big city, with its usual +, great breakfast although expensive (17€...), excellent location, cleanliness everywhere, and its usual - like expensive wi-fi connection in the rooms (1/2 hour free in the lobby). Had a superior room, but could hardly understand the difference with a regular one (the coffee machine?). Room in general was OK but it was dark, the window was on a very narrow internal court (5x5 meters) hence with no view at all. "Superior" rooms should have a bit of a view - you can't pay more to have a wall right in front of you! People at the bar very kind, but had to look for them to pay my bill. Check-in and check-out OK but folks, please try to smile sometimes! Location is great for tourists, fully packed of good restaurants and bars, metro is 2 minutes away, and puerta del Sol is a 15 minutes stroll. Location may be a winner in this sense.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: burnsziela
Reviews.Content: Its worth for its location, near Retiro Park and bordering Barrio Salamanca, walking distance from its restaurants and fashion stores. The rooms are small, but clean and enough for the stay. Lot's of noise from other clients, a big college group from Canada, some people in the hotel actually complained to the manager. Breakfast is ok. Internet was not free. Overall, as the price was cheap it was quite worth for the location.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: rosecarthane
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times, for two reasons. The location is great and the staff in the bar/cafeteria are friendly and warm. Oh, and a third reason, the rooms on the street have nice views and are quiet except during the weekend traffic jam when bars are closing. Amenities used to be great, not anymore (nice robes, all kinds of soaps, etc.-- now, no kleenex, no lotion, no shoe shine cloth, no radio, no desk lamp). There is no free WiFi. Some rooms are nice, others so small there is no room to walk around the bed. If you get one that hasn't been renovated, ask to switch. The beds and pillows and the bedding are very nice, that's a plus, and the heating/air conditioning controls work reasonably well. Watch out for the cost of the buffet breakfast if it is not included-- it is much more limited than it used to be, and about double the price-- way too expensive if all you want is a coffee and roll. The front desk staff is mostly downright rude, but there were a few, new, friendly faces-- the rude staff does significantly affect my review, though. I still love the location, but am on the lookout for a nicer place in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “what you would expect from an NH anywhere”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: 325EUR for 1 room in the NH is not cheap...but truth be told it was the day of the UEFA cup. The hotel from the outside looks not too welcoming. The rooms where small. I have to get my head around this but where ever I have been in an NH the world over they seem to use the same detergent for washing the sheets so when I wake up in the morning I have this typical NH smell in my head. Not that I like it one single bit. Location is not bad. If the Retiro park is your thing then its fine because its located at its most north easterly point. If you wanna walk down to Placa del Sol that should be around 3O-35 minutes walking. Which I would well recommend because its a lovely walk in nice weather and Madrid is a LOVELY city. Next time Im gonna try to stay at the ME by Melia hotel. That looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “just okay - like all the other reviews... nothing fantastic here.”
Reviews.Author: DHSS
Reviews.Content: I don't really have alot to add to the other reviews, they are all spot on. This is an average hotel providing average rooms and average service. The rooms were just okay, clean, small and simply appointed. This hotel is all about location (which is great). You are right near Retrio Park and the sights. The bar and lounge is very small. The internet service isn't free but the price is reasonable. All in all this is a good workhorse hotel in the heart of Madrid. Came here with a tour group and only stayed here because the tour picked it... probably wouldn't stay here on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: byrdy
Reviews.Content: After reading the poor review of this hotel I felt compelled to give my review. I stayed here with an Insight tour group of Spain and Portugal. The room was extremely clean and believe me I inspected every corner. The breakfast which was included with the tour was very good and the front desk staff was efficient, if not overly friendly. The location is good being so close to the beautiful Retiro park. There are many cafes and good shopping in the area. I would stay here again and I'm pretty darn picky.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but expensive for what it oiffers.”
Reviews.Author: whyone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, and this is the only reason I can see that they get away with cahrging ~£150 per night (excl. breakfast) for their basic rooms. The hotel itself is OK but nothing special. The bar is basic and has no atmosphere whatsoever. The breakfast is again acceptable, but nothing to write home about. My room was perfectly acceptable (and clean) though being on the 1st floor and at the front of the hotel, there was some traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: sphem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights recently. The hotel staff was rude, the room was dirty with hair and food on the floor and in the bed, the breakfast was NOT included and outrageously expensive (a great breakfast at a fraction of the cost can be found directly across the street in a cafe), wireless internet service is NOT included, irons are NOT available (but you can get ironing done by their service for the low price of 5 euros per shirt!). All this low quality for only 170+euros per night! Needless to say, I was extremely disappointed, felt completely ripped off, and will never be staying in an NH hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PetersParis
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in a single room of this hotel in March 2007. The room was unclean: I saw crumbs and hair of previous customers on the floor and the furniture was heavily stained. The air conditioner did not work properly. The staff at the reception was unfriendly. I did not get what one can expect for the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reeshard
Reviews.Content: Nice property in a great location, so it's too bad the front desk staff are surly and/or rude so much of the time. Early coffee service promised in promotional materials had to be "ordered a day in advance." Management is sloppy and indifferent to guest service. Not what I expected from a 4 star hotel at this price. Other hotels we stayed at in Spain at the same or lower price were far superior in service. This is a 3 star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scheng
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel - convenient and modern. The metro stop (Verana) was a two minute walk away, and the cafe across the street was good. The rooms were well-maintained.
